posts.post_content: Like all five-color creatures, Cromat combos well with all those two-color auras from Shadowmoor-Eventide. Just be sure to play [Clout of the Dominus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Clout of the Dominus) last. [Transguild Courrier](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Transguild Courrier) is certainly easier to play, but it doesn't have all those cool abilities.

posts.post_content:
I think my favorite part about him, aside from being an amazing EDH General, is how flavorful his abilities are.  
  
![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol): Very flavorful to both colors regarding destruction, leaning more towards the white though due to no color/type distinction necessary, and the block requirement that most white removal/tricks are known for.  
  
![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol): Blue is the color most-known for flying, with red being a very close second due to the large appeal in the casual player-base for dragons.  
  
![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol): Now while green just screams regeneration on this, despite black not being too well known on the matter, it's a sort of instant speed reanimation when it would be destroyed.  
  
![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol): White is known for having ![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol): ~ gets +0/+1. Red is known for [Firebreathing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Firebreathing). Not too much rocket science there!  
  
![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol): Green and Blue LOVE to toss stuff back on top of libraries. Some of my favorite cards for this are [Primal Command](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primal Command), [Temporal Spring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Temporal Spring), and [M](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=M)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

: Very flavorful to both colors regarding destruction, leaning more towards the white though due to no color/type distinction necessary, and the block requirement that most white removal/tricks are known for.

: Blue is the color most-known for flying, with red being a very close second due to the large appeal in the casual player-base for dragons.

: Now while green just screams regeneration on this, despite black not being too well known on the matter, it's a sort of instant speed reanimation when it would be destroyed.

posts.post_content:
@guy before me without a real name cuz it's all numbers and jank jankety jank jank:  
From the Vault is not JUST about broken cards. It's about powerful Nostalgia for the game of Magic. [Shivan Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shivan Dragon) is one of the greatest hits in the history of the game- it's Alpha version is worth over 4 1st Edition Charizards because MAGIC is (minimum) a 4x Better Game than Pokemon. While it's true that From the Vault should not read like a "Savor the Flavor" laundry list (Ironically, From the Vault Legends- looking at you) of a bunch of Vorthos-tastic cards that have no real value, [Progenitus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Progenitus), unlike [Cromat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cromat), is a much more recent card, much more powerful, and priveledged to be a good candidate for a Duel Decks or Modern Masters release. Cromat will have no such opportunities. Even if "Scars of Dominaria" or "Return to Terisiare" were to happen, Cromat will be forgotten. From the Vault is also a home for cards that can be printed no-where ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
This dude makes a very fun EDH commander. The obvious things about him (her? it? Opinions?) are obviously awesome- he can fly, you don't want to block him and he's a mean defender, he can pump a little, he can not die, and what's that, a pacifism? Nah, I'll just redraw and replay him for 5 mana next turn, thank you very much...  
  
 What may be slightly less obvious is how rainbow Cromat gives you access to cards of all colors. This is a big deal in EDH- there's no card in MTG that you aren't allowed to play with Cromat as your commander. So you can wipe the board with white, clone things with blue (great against legendary generals) and play [Ixidron](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ixidron), tutor and kill stuff with black, haste your general with red, pump your general with green... You also have access to charms and multi-part cards, helping you to do everything all the time. And you can use cool rainbow stuff like the Bringers. Also the stuff that makes a creature better the more colors i... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Raibys (7/29/2011 2:27:14 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I've always liked Cromat for his novelty and mix of abilities so I have an EDH deck built around him. He combos well with many cards, most of which have already been mentioned, but [Pledge of loyalty](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pledge of loyalty) is one of my favourites as it gives him protection almost as good as [Progenitus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Progenitus) making him very hard to kill and almost unblockable (great for a strong EDH commander) with the advantage that you can still attach equipment to him making it better than the usual [Whispersilk Cloak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whispersilk Cloak) in my opinion.   
 For those of you who don't know he was created when the Phyrexians merged their artificial plane of Rath into Dominaria during their invasion; Cromat was created from the raw mana mixing on the boundary as two planes merged.
posts.html:
I've always liked Cromat for his novelty and mix of abilities so I have an EDH deck built around him. He combos well with many cards, most of which have already been mentioned, but Pledge of loyalty is one of my favourites as it gives him protection almost as good as Progenitus making him very hard to kill and almost unblockable (great for a strong EDH commander) with the advantage that you can still attach equipment to him making it better than the usual Whispersilk Cloak in my opinion.
For those of you who don't know he was created when the Phyrexians merged their artificial plane of Rath into Dominaria during their invasion; Cromat was created from the raw mana mixing on the boundary as two planes merged.
